Bode hat-trick sees York take Indoor Hockey spoils

A hat-trick from Nico Bode saw York record a memorable win in the Mens' Firsts' Indoor Hockey and snatch the overall Indoor Hockey points victory by 3.5 to 2.5 (Thumbnail credit Match-winner Bode celebrates the victory)

Defiant frisbee-ers undone by Lancaster comeback

A defiant performance by York's mixed ultimate frisbee firsts was not enought to beat an impressive Lancaster team in the outdoor event this morning (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

Indoor football firsts take early York points

Last gasp goals from Conor Brennan and Jack Crane gave York their first victory of Friday, winning a thrilling encounter 4-2. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

Roses 2010: Friday - As it happened

Live coverage for the opening day of Roses 2010

Derwent and Alcuin paired in College Cup group stages

The draw for the group stages of the College Cup was made this evening, with some interesting pairings including heavyweights Derwent and Alcuin (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Peter Iveson)

College Cup draw

The <em>Nouse</em> Sports live blog for the College Cup draw (Thumbnail credit Parris Williams scored for Alcuin against Vanbrugh in the 2009 College Cup Final, photo: George Lowther)

Best finish in three years for Karting Club

York's Karting teams put in a decent performance in the final three rounds of the British Uni Karting Championships to take its best placed finish for three years (Thumbnail credit Photograph courtesy York University Karting Club)

Tiger Woods or Golf - where does the power lie?

Sam Morgan argues that the Tiger Woods scandal strikes right at the heart of golf, confirming that the 18-time Major winner has become bigger than the game itself. (Thumbnail credit Keith Allison, through Flickr Creative Commons )

The Greatest Goals of all time - Join the debate

In the week that Lionel Messi single-handedly destroyed Arsenal, Jake Farrell picks his favourite five goals that not only displayed exemplary class and technique but came at the most crucial of times (Thumbnail credit prettyfriendship via Flickr Creative Commons)

Roses Preview - Flashback to 2009

A look back at the highlights from Roses 2009, a memorable weekend for the University of York (Thumbnail credit Dom O'Shea celebrates his goal in the football firsts' 4-0 win. Photograph by Arran Bowen-la Grange)

Roses Preview - History of the Tournament

A brief history of Roses, the annual sports tournament between the universities of York and Lancaster (Thumbnail credit The Carter-James Trophy. Photograph by George Lowther)

Rowing absent from schedule for 46th Roses tournament

The timetable for the 2010 Roses competition between York and Lancaster has been unveiled, though Rowing, the tournament's inaugural event, will be missing (Thumbnail credit York celebrate another success in last year's rowing regatta, which they won 12-8. Photograph by George Lowther.)

Bode treble secures BUCS Cup glory for hockey firsts

By James Bithell

York now have a trophy to set alongside their strong mid-table league finish after comofrtaly beating MMU Cheshire 4-1 in the final of the BUCS Northern Conference Cup this week (Thumbnail credit Photographs by James Branton)

Wilkinson should not be the scapegoat for England's failings

Jonny Wilkinson should not take the blame for England's inability to play any imaginative rugby in their unsuccessful Six Nations campaign. (Thumbnail credit Paddy-K via Flickr Creative Commons)

Women's firsts deny Hallam promotion at the death

By James Bithell

A stoppage time goal from Katy Ballentyne earned York a 1-1 draw against promotion-chasing Sheffield Hallam on Wednesday, in the second meeting of the teams in three days (Thumbnail credit The University of York Women's Football firsts 2009-2010. Photograph courtesy UYWAFC)

Wednesday Round-up: March 17th

All of Wednesday's results from our sports teams on the final afternoon of the BUCS season (Thumbnail credit Action from the Netball firsts' match with Teesside. Photograph by Peter Iveson)

Women's Rugby storm to massive victory over Newcastle

By James Bithell

York rounded off their season in style with a 124-0 rout of Newcastle on Wednesday, a result which provided a big confidence boost ahead of Roses next month (Thumbnail credit Kate Fullilove scored four tries in Wednesday's victory. Photograph by George Lowther)

Netball firsts keep their heads to overcome Teesside

York held their nerve in the final quarter to beat top-of-the-table Teesside 28-26, securing their League 4B status for another season (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Peter Iveson)

The Mixer at the YUSU Elections

The Mixer is of the opinion that this year's York Sport Presidential election was too nice

Alcuin upset the odds to take College Rugby Tens title

Alcuin confounded every assumption that had been made about College Rugby last Saturday by beating an eminent James college side in the final of a thrilling tens tournament (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Halifax and Derwent frustrated as Alcuin close the gap

Derwent missed the opportunity to extend their lead at the top of the College Football league beyond a solitary point after labouring to a 0-0 draw with Vanbrugh (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Peter Iveson)

BUCS season review

By James Bithell

With success, failure and scandal, it's been one of the most exciting BUCS seasons in recent memory. As it comes to a close, Leigh Clarke looks at how York's main clubs have fared

Tee and Neuner lead YUsnow medal rush

York University Snowsports proved that although the University may be small, it is still strong, at the British Universities Indoor Snowsports Championships Finals recently (Thumbnail credit Photograph of Dave Tee courtesy BUSC Media Crew)

Futsallers denied at the death in BUCS Championships

York's Futsallers can take away some valuable lessons from this week's BUCS Championships in Sheffield, producing an excellent team effort and valiant performances in all their games - and very nearly turning the championships on its head in the process (Thumbnail credit Ben Smith in action during the BUCS Championships qualifers. Photograph courtesy York University Futsal Club)

Asfahani ushers in new York Sport vision

Sports Editor Adam Shergold talks to Sam Asfahani, the new York Sport President, on his long-term vision for better facilities, an elite athlete fund and greater success for York (Thumbnail credit Photograph by George Lowther)

Fencers start life in North Premier with funding crisis

A superb season for York's female fencers came to a glorious end on Wednesday when they defeated Newcastle University 123-84 to clinch promotion to the Northern Premier League (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Peter Iveson)

Brilliant Teesside showing sees Karting climb the table

By James Bithell

York produced their best performance of the BUKC season to date on their 'home' track in Teesside, raising hopes they can finish the season in the top 25 positions (Thumbnail credit Photograph courtesy University of York Karting Club)

Success on two fronts for the University Boat Club

By James Bithell

In one of their most successful weekends ever, the University of York Boat Club competed on the River Thames, in the Women's Head of the River, and the Ouse, at the Yorkshire Head (Thumbnail credit Both the York University novice and senior men's crews finished second at the Yorkshire Head yesterday. Photograph courtesy of Seb Allen, UYBC)
